headline: Zenity Labs Exposes Widespread "AgentFlayer" Vulnerabilities Allowing Silent Hijacking of Major Enterprise AI Agents Circumventing Human Oversight
summary: At Black Hat USA 2025, Zenity Labs revealed AgentFlayer, a comprehensive set of 0click exploit chains that allow attackers to silently compromise enterprise AI agents and assistants without requiring any user action. The research, presented by Zenity co-founder and CTO Michael Bargury and threat researcher Tamir Ishay Sharbat in their session, "AI Enterprise Compromise: 0Click Exploit Methods," demonstrates how widely deployed AI agents from major vendors can be hijacked to exfiltrate data, mani

headline: Stocks higher with eyes on earnings, US tariff deadline
summary: Wall Street stocks rebounded Wednesday led by Apple and other large tech companies as markets largely shrugged off US President Donald Trump's latest tariff hikes.Dozens of economies around the world including the European Union and India are set to face higher US tariffs on Thursday, as US President Donald Trump's long-threatened "reciprocal" duties over trade practices he deems unfair take effect.

headline: Why Chegg (CHGG) Shares Are Falling Today
summary: Shares of online study and academic help platform Chegg (NYSE:CHGG) fell 13.2% in the afternoon session after the company reported dismal second-quarter results that revealed a sharp decline in subscribers and a weak forecast for future revenue. The education technology company reported a steep 40% year-over-year drop in its subscriber numbers, which fell to 2.6 million. This significant decline in users overshadowed the fact that Chegg's revenue and earnings per share actually beat Wall Street'

headline: Google commits $1 billion for AI training at US universities
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Alphabet's Google on Wednesday announced a three-year, $1 billion commitment to provide artificial intelligence training and tools to U.S. higher education institutions and nonprofits.  Participating schools may receive cash funding and resources, such as cloud computing credits towards AI training for students as well as research on AI-related topics.  The billion-dollar figure also includes the value of paid AI tools, such as an advanced version of the Gemini chatbot, which Google will give to college students for free.

raw.headline: Google commits $1 billion for AI training at US universities
raw.summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Alphabet's Google on Wednesday announced a three-year, $1 billion commitment to provide artificial intelligence training and tools to U.S. higher education institutions and nonprofits.  Participating schools may receive cash funding and resources, such as cloud computing credits towards AI training for students as well as research on AI-related topics.  The billion-dollar figure also includes the value of paid AI tools, such as an advanced version of the Gemini chatbot, which Google will give to college students for free.

headline: Snap Stock Is Tumbling on Disappointing Earnings
summary: Shares of  Snap  were falling sharply Wednesday after the social-media company reported worse-than-expected second-quarter financial results.  Analysts surveyed by FactSet had expected the company to lose 15 cents a share on revenue of $1.35 billion.  Snap also said daily active users in the quarter increased 9% from last year to 469 million, beating Wall Street estimates of 467.4 million.

raw.headline: Snap Stock Is Tumbling on Disappointing Earnings
raw.summary: Shares of  Snap  were falling sharply Wednesday after the social-media company reported worse-than-expected second-quarter financial results.  Analysts surveyed by FactSet had expected the company to lose 15 cents a share on revenue of $1.35 billion.  Snap also said daily active users in the quarter increased 9% from last year to 469 million, beating Wall Street estimates of 467.4 million.

headline: Uber in talks with banks, private equity firms to fund robotaxi expansion
summary: (Reuters) -Uber is in talks with private equity firms and banks to secure funds to build its robotaxi business, CEO Dara Khosrowshahi said, as the ride-hailing giant bets on a mass roll-out of the nascent and much-scrutinized technology.  The company has been offering robotaxis from Alphabet-owned Waymo on its ride-hailing app in Austin and Atlanta.  Khosrowshahi on Wednesday pitched the tie-ups as part of a larger plan that involves three robotaxi business models: paying partners that own such vehicles a fixed rate, sharing revenue with fleet operators and owning vehicles while licensing software for self-driving technology.

raw.headline: Uber in talks with banks, private equity firms to fund robotaxi expansion
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Uber is in talks with private equity firms and banks to secure funds to build its robotaxi business, CEO Dara Khosrowshahi said, as the ride-hailing giant bets on a mass roll-out of the nascent and much-scrutinized technology.  The company has been offering robotaxis from Alphabet-owned Waymo on its ride-hailing app in Austin and Atlanta.  Khosrowshahi on Wednesday pitched the tie-ups as part of a larger plan that involves three robotaxi business models: paying partners that own such vehicles a fixed rate, sharing revenue with fleet operators and owning vehicles while licensing software for self-driving technology.

headline: How AI stocks and earnings are driving the market rally
summary: You can catch Trader Talk on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, YouTube, or wherever you get your podcasts. Is this bull market stronger than Wall Street thinks? On this episode of Trader Talk, Kenny Polcari and Bullseye Brief founder Adam Johnson explain why artificial intelligence (AI)–driven capital spending, strong earnings, and resilient consumer demand could push stocks even higher. They reveal how savvy investors are reading earnings reports for future signals and why the Federal Reserve may not need to cut rates as soon as traders expect. Watch more episodes of Trader Talk here. Trader Talk with Kenny Polcari on Yahoo Finance delivers expert analysis and actionable insights, empowering you to navigate market volatility and secure your financial future. This post was written by Langston Sessoms.

headline: As AI Changes Internet Search, Reddit Lies in a Sweet Spot
summary: Artificial-intelligence chatbots are leaning more and more on  Reddit  these days.  Reddit’s “other revenue,” which is comprised mostly of licensing deals it has struck with OpenAI and Google, accounted for only 7% of total revenue during the quarter.  Clearly, Reddit’s near- and midterm future relies on advertising, which means it needs human users visiting its site.
